enrl_requirement: Enrollment Requirements: Prerequisite: Students must complete Psych 205-0 before taking this course.
title: WCAS PSYCH 357-0-21 Advanced Seminar in Personality, Clinical, or Social Psychology

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This discussion-based course focuses on the connection between conceptions of the self and goal-oriented motivation, with particular attention devoted to the influence of social, structural, and cultural forces. The first segment of the term will cover classic theoretical work concerning the self and identity. Next, we will consider the relevance of a variety of social influences on identity and motivation. Finally, the course will close with a survey of contemporary identity-based intervention research and practical applications relating to trends in social inequalities, including education and health.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Students submit weekly discussion questions, complete a take-home midterm, a group presentation, and a take-home final.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: There is no textbook for the class.

subject: PSYCH
